metadata.title: CVE-2022-35229 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An authenticated user can create a link with reflected Javascript codeinside it for the discovery page and send it to other users. The payloadcan be executed only with a known CSRF token value of the victim, which ischanged periodically and is difficult to predict.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.0.17+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
